poem:
### Glasgow Boys

In the quiet corner of a Glasgow street,  
two boys, arms slung over each other's shoulders,  
walk against the current of the world—  
away from screens and chatter  
into that small, sunlit space  
where friendship is a whisper,  
and words unsaid paint  
the sky's invisible canvas  
with the bright colors of quiet bravery.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘One kid at a time’: How children’s books on male friendship could combat toxic masculinity This year’s Carnegie medals for children’s writing, awarded on Thursday, brought to light an unexpected trend. The winner, Margaret McDonald’s superb debut, Glasgow Boys,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
